almost_halloween.description: After many changes of mind (knight, princess, tunnel monster), Felix finally settled on the one, the only, the obvious choice for Halloween.  Baby Dog, of course, will be going as Super Dog.
almost_halloween.title: Almost Halloween

almost_halloween2.description: Super Mom pilots the Super Stroller.
almost_halloween2.title: Almost Halloween 2

block_00.description: We had a block party!   Block parties are a Berkeley tradition, though our block hadn't seen one in a while.   It was Felix's idea:  after seeing other blocks have parties, he wanted one.   So Lucie put flyers in everyone's mailbox, started an e-mail list for the block, and got a traffic-stopping permit from the city.   Lots of people pitched in, and it just came together.
block_00.title: Block

block_01.description: The party was a big success.  Good weather, good food, great music.  It was really nice to get a chance to know our neighbors better.  Turns out there's something like 20 kids between the ages of 0 and 6.
block_01.title: Block 1

block_02_blues.description: The blues band was excellent.  This picture was taken from our yard.
block_02_blues.title: Block 02 Blues

block_03_lucie.description: Lucie and Milo hit the dance floor.
block_03_lucie.title: Block 03 Lucie

block_04_lineup.description: Blues wasn't the only music on the menu.   Chalk on the sidewalk announced the lineup.
block_04_lineup.title: Block 04 Lineup

block_05_jug.description: The jug band didn't have an actual jug, but they did have a washboard and some crazy instrument made of a plastic tub and a broom. They were great!
block_05_jug.title: Block 05 Jug

block_06_dream.description: This rock band lives a few houses down from us.  The drummer is also named Dean.
block_06_dream.title: Block 06 Dream

block_07_jim.description: Jim, our next door neighbor, single-handedly made the music happen: he borrowed the equipment, set it up, and got bands to show up and play. Go, Jim!
block_07_jim.title: Block 07 Jim

block_07_subway.description: Also next door is Subway Guitars.  It's owned by Fat Dog, who makes guitars for famous people like Bob Dylan, Santana, and the B-52's.
block_07_subway.title: Block 07 Subway

block_08_backstage.description: Lots of people showed up:  neighbors, friends, and passers-by attracted by the good tunes.
block_08_backstage.title: Block 08 Backstage

block_09_marybeth.description:
Mary Beth, Jim's girlfriend, set up a face painting station.

Eli, on mom Rebecca's lap, is getting cold feet. They're also on the block. She's 6 months pregnant with her second boy.
block_09_marybeth.title: Block 09 Marybeth

block_10_emma.description: Emma is braver and submits her cheeks.
block_10_emma.title: Block 10 Emma

block_11_lego.description: We emptied our toys onto the sidewalk.
block_11_lego.title: Block 11 Lego

block_12_susi.description:
The woman in black sweater and glasses is Susi, our neighbor from Germany. Her son, Bruno, is just a few months older than Milo. We see each other at playgrounds occasionally.

See the guy with the guitar? I would have liked him to play! But no, he just listened for a while.
block_12_susi.title: Block 12 Susi

block_13_lego.description: Milo loved getting his hands on Felix's legos.
block_13_lego.title: Block 13 Lego

block_14_bruno.description: Simon, in the green vest, proved to be a talented Lego builder. On the other side of the table is Bruno and Mattias. Mattias is here doing his post doc; he and his family will go back to Germany next year, before we have another block party.
block_14_bruno.title: Block 14 Bruno

block_15_amithi.description: Amithi and mom Deepa show off her painted cheeks.  They moved in just a few months ago, from Toronto.
block_15_amithi.title: Block 15 Amithi

block_16_mickey.description: Mickey and Debbie were a huge help in making the block party happen.
block_16_mickey.title: Block 16 Mickey

block_17.description: One house on our street hosts many Chinese families. The lady who lives there helps them immigrate from mainland China. The families typically stay for a year, learn English, and then set off on their own.
block_17.title: Block 17

block_18_taj.description: The guy with the hat is Taj.  He's also our next door neighbor.  He's a musician, and lots of his friends are musicians as well.  We often hear good live music coming out of his house.
block_18_taj.title: Block 18 Taj

block_19_eli.description: Eli enjoyed our selection of cars.
block_19_eli.title: Block 19 Eli

block_20_jeannie.description: Jeannie lives across the street.  She has 4 children: twins Emma and Asher, age 6, and twins Rena and Ezra, who just turned 1. Here she is with Rena.
block_20_jeannie.title: Block 20 Jeannie

block_21_twins.description: Double cuteness!  Rena and Ezra take our truck for a spin.
block_21_twins.title: Block 21 Twins

block_22_supermen.description: Apparently our block is big enough for two Supermen:  there was no deathmatch.
block_22_supermen.title: Block 22 Supermen

block_23.description: We took our benches in the street to enjoy the music and soak up the rays.
block_23.title: Block 23

milo2.description: He's been very into his tongue.
milo2.title: Milo 2

pumpkin1.description: We got 5 pumpkins, 1 per family member:  a big one for papa, a medium one for mom, a small one for Felix, and a tiny one apiece for Milo and Baby Dog.
pumpkin1.title: Pumpkin 1

pumpkin2.description: Milo wants a spot on the Olympic pumpkin shotputting team.
pumpkin2.title: Pumpkin 2

description:
Milo's getting more opinionated, and starting to throw tantrums when he doesn't get his way. He's still somewhat easily redirected, but it's definitely a change from the days when he just crawled and cooed. He's even starting to chase after Felix and try to take back toys that he thinks Felix took from him.

Perhaps to compensate, his sense of humor is develolping. He never met a fart he didn't laugh at.

Felix is getting, well, older. He wants more Superman books so he can learn everything about him. And he wonders why sometimes power lines just end, when their job is to take electricity from the power station to houses. And he's trying to pin down at exactly what age he's allowed to have small Star Wars legos, and what age he can get a dog.

Latest language development:

  • go!!!: Let's go outside!!! Not new, but now said the same way a cavalry officer says "charge!". And he does it while banging on the front door.
title: October 23
